title: App crashes when editing channel permission

labels.name: E:Desktop Community Admin Improvements
labels.description: Implementation of the needed improvements for the Admin events to be stable.

milestone.description:
Milestone cycles:

[Cycle 1](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+milestone%3A0.14+label%3AC1): 7 July
[Cycle 2](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+milestone%3A0.14+label%3AC2): 28 July 
[Cycle 3](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+milestone%3A0.14+label%3AC3): 18 August


**--- Main focus ---**

**1. Token permissions to enable control of community smart contracts**
- Before a community founder can use any of the community token admin functionality, they first have to deploy Owner and Token Master contracts.
- This work involves: new empty state screen for Mint and Airdrop tokens (before current empty state screen is revealed), new flow for deploying the community's Owner and Token Master contracts in a single step, a fixed uneditable permission giving anybody who holds the Token Master token admin rights for the community should be automatically created.
- Only the holder of the single Owner token can access the Token Master airdrop, remote destruct, and view holders functions. Anybody who holds the Token Master token can access all token admin options, excluding those related to the Token Master token itself, as well as being and Admin of the community.
- This will all be explained in more detail in the designs.

Backend Epic: https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11249

**2. Update Community Admin home screen inc control node transfer and associated dialogues**
- Remove ability for a Owner to leave a community on the computer that's running as that community's control node
- Community Admin home screen cleanup (inc. adding at least one of the three graphs, whichever is easiest to implement).
  - Graph issue: https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11152  
  - Community overview: https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11278

**3. Ability for user to select & manage accounts shared with each community control node**
- This item is quite a bit of work
- Touches Community settings, as well as all of the community join flows
- Backend issues: 
  - Join API: https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11154
  - Edit API: https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11153

**4. Encryption for token gated channels that are inside Open (not token gated) communities**
[#10998](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/10998)

**5. Final screens and bits and bobs needed prior to public beta**
- Modal that's shown every time after login, reminding user's that Status Desktop is in Beta [#11044](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11044)
- The bug with 'requests to join' a community not constantly arriving, or sometimes arriving after a delay, must be fixed. [#8264](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/8264)
- Anything that didn't get completed in 0.13 related to new share URL format
- All the outstanding bugs and small items that got pushed into the 0.14 milestone.


**--- Things that we SHOULD NOT work on during the 0.14 cycle ---**
- Messaging and UI teams shouldn't work on perf. in 0.14 (but Wallet team should!)
- Anything big mutual contacts related, other than fixing small bugs we find like #10497 #10498 #11120 #11121  (hopefully this functionality working good enough now!)

**--- Wallet Team ---**

1. Finish any outstanding work related to Activity screens (top priority - aim to have complete by July 14th)

2. Updated Wallet Settings screens UI inc. account syncing functionality  *Synced information should immediately be reflected in the UI after it is received (sometimes synced info is currently only displayed after the next app restart, this needs to be fixed)*

3. Wallet performance and memory consumption optimisations

4. Fix bugs, clean up loose ends (to get things in a good state before the work on the Mobile wallet starts)

body:
# Bug Report

## Description

<!-- Provide a short description describing the problem you are experiencing. -->

![image](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/assets/33099791/b6b310cb-0a5e-4579-8c42-08a23ad77c5b)


Stack trace:
```
libstatus.so.0!crypto/ecdsa.(*PublicKey).Equal(crypto/ecdsa.PublicKey * pub, crypto.PublicKey x) (/usr/local/go/src/crypto/ecdsa/ecdsa.go:78)
libstatus.so.0!github.com/status-im/status-go/protocol/communities.validateAndGetEventsMessageCommunityDescription([]uint8 signedDescription, crypto/ecdsa.PublicKey * signerPubkey) (/home/osmaczny/Dev/status/status-desktop/vendor/status-go/protocol/communities/community_event.go:432)
libstatus.so.0!github.com/status-im/status-go/protocol/communities.(*Community).addNewCommunityEvent(github.com/status-im/status-go/protocol/communities.Community * o, github.com/status-im/status-go/protocol/communities.CommunityEvent * event) (/home/osmaczny/Dev/status/status-desktop/vendor/status-go/protocol/communities/community_event.go:390)
libstatus.so.0!github.com/status-im/status-go/protocol/communities.(*Community).UpdateTokenPermission(github.com/status-im/status-go/protocol/communities.Community * o, string permissionID, github.com/status-im/status-go/protocol/protobuf.CommunityTokenPermission * tokenPermission) (/home/osmaczny/Dev/status/status-desktop/vendor/status-go/protocol/communities/community.go:1523)
libstatus.so.0!github.com/status-im/status-go/protocol/communities.(*Manager).EditCommunityTokenPermission(github.com/status-im/status-go/protocol/communities.Manager * m, github.com/status-im/status-go/protocol/requests.EditCommunityTokenPermission * request) (/home/osmaczny/Dev/status/status-desktop/vendor/status-go/protocol/communities/manager.go:610)
libstatus.so.0!github.com/status-im/status-go/protocol.(*Messenger).EditCommunityTokenPermission(github.com/status-im/status-go/protocol.Messenger * m, github.com/status-im/status-go/protocol/requests.EditCommunityTokenPermission * request) (/home/osmaczny/Dev/status/status-desktop/vendor/status-go/protocol/messenger_communities.go:1721)
libstatus.so.0!github.com/status-im/status-go/services/ext.(*PublicAPI).EditCommunityTokenPermission(github.com/status-im/status-go/services/ext.PublicAPI * api) (/home/osmaczny/Dev/status/status-desktop/vendor/status-go/services/ext/api.go:538)
libstatus.so.0!github.com/status-im/status-go/services/wakuv2ext.(*PublicAPI).EditCommunityTokenPermission(github.com/status-im/status-go/protocol/requests.EditCommunityTokenPermission * request) (<autogenerated>:1)
libstatus.so.0!runtime.call16() (/usr/local/go/src/runtime/asm_amd64.s:728)
libstatus.so.0!runtime.reflectcall(runtime._type * stackArgsType, void * fn, void * stackArgs, uint32 stackArgsSize, uint32 stackRetOffset, uint32 frameSize, internal/abi.RegArgs * regArgs) (<autogenerated>:1)

libstatus.so.0!reflect.Value.Call(reflect.Value v, []reflect.Value in) (/usr/local/go/src/reflect/value.go:370)
libstatus.so.0!github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/rpc.(*callback).call(github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/rpc.callback * c, context.Context ctx, string method, []reflect.Value args, interface {} res, error errRes) (/home/osmaczny/Dev/status/status-desktop/vendor/status-go/vendor/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/rpc/service.go:205)
libstatus.so.0!github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/rpc.(*handler).runMethod(github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/rpc.handler * h, context.Context ctx, github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/rpc.jsonrpcMessage * msg, github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/rpc.callback * callb, []reflect.Value args) (/home/osmaczny/Dev/status/status-desktop/vendor/status-go/vendor/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/rpc/handler.go:391)

libstatus.so.0!github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/rpc.(*handler).handleCallMsg(github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/rpc.handler * h, []interface {} ctx, github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/rpc.jsonrpcMessage * msg) (/home/osmaczny/Dev/status/status-desktop/vendor/status-go/vendor/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/rpc/handler.go:297)
libstatus.so.0!github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/rpc.(*handler).handleMsg.func1(github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/rpc.callProc * cp) (/home/osmaczny/Dev/status/status-desktop/vendor/status-go/vendor/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/rpc/handler.go:138)
libstatus.so.0!github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/rpc.(*handler).startCallProc.func1() (/home/osmaczny/Dev/status/status-desktop/vendor/status-go/vendor/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/rpc/handler.go:225)
libstatus.so.0!runtime.goexit() (/usr/local/go/src/runtime/asm_amd64.s:1598)
[Unknown/Just-In-Time compiled code] (Unknown Source:0)
```

## Steps to reproduce

Edit channel permission, click "Update permission" button.

#### Expected behavior

Permission updated.

#### Actual behavior

App crash.

### Additional Information

- Status desktop version: master (44cf2b6faa6700b66da982ebaf6f60a958af3762)
- Operating System: Fedora 38

The problem is that account was backuped without the signature (MarshalledCommunityDescription).
The account became an owner without a community private key. I still do not understand how it could be, taking into account, that before restoring an account by seed phrase - this account was a control node

The bug is that:
Being an owner without a community private key - we are trying to send an event, if it is first ever event that will be sent on top of the current CommunityDescription clock - we verify if MarshalledCommunityDescription contains the signature
In this case, the signature was absent and it returns nil, nil. Here is my fault as I thought in case of an absent signature it will return an error.

Again, the question is - how restoring an account by a seed phrase could we get a MarshalledCommunityDescription without the signature? I know only one scenario - if I'm a member or privileged user (non-control node) and I'm receiving an admin event. In this case, if we do any backup without verifying MarshalledCommunityDescription, this can happen

This crash will be fixed by verifying the signature != nil, but without a signed CommunityDescription, you, as an owner without a community key, will not be able to do any actions, because if there were no events before - we must build events on top of the signed CommunityDescription and we don't have it

cc @osmaczko , @jrainville

> I still do not understand how it could be, taking into account, that before restoring an account by seed phrase - this account was a control node

IIRC I restored account two times.

Does this still happen? I know @mprakhov introduced a small fix.

Also, if we do https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11713, this issue shouldn't happen again?

It should not crashing anymore, but we will have another problem here. If are a privileged user and we'll get an unsigned CommunityDescription , we will not have the possibility to do any admin actions as the `first` event can't be built on top of the unsigned CommunityDescription
Yeah, https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11713 should fix it right? If so, I'll just close this one and we'll work on https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/11713
